required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety of Novartis MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine When Administered With Routine Infant Vaccinations to Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b, Open-Label, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate the Safety of Novartis MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine When Administered With Routine Infant Vaccinations to Healthy Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this phase 3b study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of Novartis MenACWY conjugate vaccine when administered with routine infant vaccinations to healthy infants

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Severe Systemic Reaction After Any Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes to Day 7 after any vaccination administered at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age
primary_outcome.description: To compare the percentages of subjects who reported at least one severe systemic reaction after any vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 (detailed) plus routine vaccines (detailed) group to that observed in the routine vaccines alone (detailed) group administered at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age. Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all Adverse Events (AEs) for 7 days, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended AEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Serious Adverse Event During the Entire Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (2 months of age) to 18 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the percentages of subjects presenting at least one serious adverse event (SAE) through 6 months post-final dose in subjects who received MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the percentages of subjects who received routine vaccinations alone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events, After Each Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the percentage of subjects who reported local and systemic solicited adverse events from day 1 to day 7 after each vaccination with MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the routine vaccinations alone group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Reported Unsolicited Adverse Events After Any Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (2 months of age) to 18 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Safety data with medically attended events were collected throughout the study in the non-detailed safety groups and from Day 8 onwards for the detailed safety groups.

arm_group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR: 12 months. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - infants who only provided SAEs (Serious Adverse Events) and medically attended AEs (Adverse Events).

Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR: 12 months. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

intervention.description: Four 0.5mL vaccinations of MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine was administered by intramuscular injection at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age.
Four vaccinations of DTaP (Diptheria, Tetanus, Pertussis) was administered at 2, 4, 6, and 15 months of age.
Four vaccinations of Hib (Haemophilus influenza b) vaccine was administered at 2, 4, 6 and 15 months of age.
Three vaccinations of IPV (Inactivated Polio Vaccine) was administered at 2, 4, and 6 months of age.
Four vaccinations of Pneumococcal conjugate vaccine was administered at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age.
One vaccination of MMR (Measles, Mumps, and Rubella) was administered at 12 months of age.
One vaccination of Varicella vaccine was administered at 12 months of age.
One vaccination of Hepatitis A Virus vaccine was administered at 12 months of age.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects enrolled were included in the trial.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (Non-detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR: 12 months. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended Adverse (AE).

group.title: Routine Vaccines (Non-detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR: 12 months. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity, all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (Non-Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR: 12 months. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Severe Systemic Reaction After Any Vaccination
outcome.description: To compare the percentages of subjects who reported at least one severe systemic reaction after any vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 (detailed) plus routine vaccines (detailed) group to that observed in the routine vaccines alone (detailed) group administered at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age. Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all Adverse Events (AEs) for 7 days, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended AEs.
outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes to Day 7 after any vaccination administered at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age
outcome.population: Analysis was done on As Treated Safety Population - Subjects who received at least one study dose and provided postbaseline safety data, and that subjects would be included in the group for the vaccination actually received (i.e., analyzed as treated).

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all Adverse Events (AEs) for 7 days, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all Adverse Events (AEs) for 7 days, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended AEs.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Severe Systemic Reaction After Any Vaccination
measure.description: To compare the percentages of subjects who reported at least one severe systemic reaction after any vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 (detailed) plus routine vaccines (detailed) group to that observed in the routine vaccines alone (detailed) group administered at 2, 4, 6, and 12 months of age. Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all Adverse Events (AEs) for 7 days, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) and medically attended AEs.
measure.population: Analysis was done on As Treated Safety Population - Subjects who received at least one study dose and provided postbaseline safety data, and that subjects would be included in the group for the vaccination actually received (i.e., analyzed as treated).

analysis.groups_desc: MenACWY-CRM 197 administered concomitantly with routine vaccines was considered noninferior to routine vaccines alone with respect to severe systemic reactions if the upper limit of the 2-sided 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine plus routine vaccines group minus routine vaccines only group) in the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one severe systemic reaction during the first 7 days (days 1-7) after any vaccination was <6%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis associated with the safety objective was that the upper limit of the two-sided 95% CI for this difference in the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one severe systemic reaction during the first 7 days after any vaccination (PMenACWY+Routine Vaccines–PRoutine Vaccines) was ≥ 6%.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Serious Adverse Event During the Entire Study Period
outcome.description: To compare the percentages of subjects presenting at least one serious adverse event (SAE) through 6 months post-final dose in subjects who received MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the percentages of subjects who received routine vaccinations alone.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (2 months of age) to 18 months of age
outcome.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With At Least One Serious Adverse Event During the Entire Study Period
measure.description: To compare the percentages of subjects presenting at least one serious adverse event (SAE) through 6 months post-final dose in subjects who received MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the percentages of subjects who received routine vaccinations alone.
measure.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

analysis.groups_desc: MenACWY-CRM 197 administered concomitantly with routine vaccines was considered non inferior to routine vaccines alone with respect to serious adverse events if the upper limit of the 2-sided 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY vaccine plus routine vaccines group minus routine vaccines only group) of the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one serious adverse event was <5%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis associated with the SAE safety objective was that the upper limit of the two-sided 95% confidence interval for the difference between the MenACWY and routine vaccine groups in the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one SAE (PMenACWY + Routine Vaccines – PRoutine Vaccines) was ≥5%.

analysis.groups_desc: MenACWY-CRM 197 administered concomitantly with routine vaccines was considered non inferior to routine vaccines alone with respect to serious adverse events if the upper limit of the 2-sided 95% CI of the difference (MenACWY vaccine plus routine vaccines group minus routine vaccines only group) of the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one serious adverse event was <5%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis associated with the SAE safety objective was that the upper limit of the two-sided 95% confidence interval for the difference between the MenACWY and routine vaccine groups in the proportion of subjects experiencing at least one SAE (PMenACWY + Routine Vaccines – PRoutine Vaccines) was <5%.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events, After Each Vaccination
outcome.description: To compare the percentage of subjects who reported local and systemic solicited adverse events from day 1 to day 7 after each vaccination with MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the routine vaccinations alone group.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM 197 + Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (Detailed)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6 months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. Detailed - subjects who provided reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events, After Each Vaccination
measure.description: To compare the percentage of subjects who reported local and systemic solicited adverse events from day 1 to day 7 after each vaccination with MenACWY-CRM197 given concomitantly with routine vaccinations to the routine vaccinations alone group.
measure.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Reported Unsolicited Adverse Events After Any Vaccination
outcome.description: Safety data with medically attended events were collected throughout the study in the non-detailed safety groups and from Day 8 onwards for the detailed safety groups.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (2 months of age) to 18 months of age
outcome.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - infants who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - infants who provided reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - infants who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Reported Unsolicited Adverse Events After Any Vaccination
measure.description: Safety data with medically attended events were collected throughout the study in the non-detailed safety groups and from Day 8 onwards for the detailed safety groups.
measure.population: Analysis was done on as treated safety population.

reported_events.desc: Post-injection solicited Adverse Events (AEs) were collected from Days 1-7 after each vaccination in detailed group. Medically attended AEs and Serious AEs were collected throughout the study period. Subjects who terminated early were followed for 6 months post final dose for safety.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM197 + Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of MenACWY-CRM197 vaccine at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months of age and one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

group.title: Routine Vaccines (All)
group.description: Infants received one vaccination of routine vaccines (according to the local vaccination schedule) - DTaP: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, IPV: 2, 4, 6, months, Hib: 2, 4, 6, 15 months, Pneumococcal conjugate: 2, 4, 6, 12 months, MMR, Varicella, and Hepatitis A: 12 months. HBV and rotavirus vaccines should be administered according to ACIP guidelines during the first year of life. Routine vaccines given to subjects in these arms will be consistent with the US ACIP recommended vaccines. All (Detailed and Non-Detailed subjects): Detailed - subjects who provided Reactogenicity and all AEs for 7 days, SAEs and medically attended AEs; Non-Detailed - subjects who only provided SAEs and medically attended AEs.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
